Title: Love, Simon | Official Trailer 2 [HD] | 20th Century FOX
Comment:
This movie brought out so many emotions in me, but I know I couldn't come out to anyone (only anonymously like now)..I don't have a perfect family - my mom raised me alone and my dad... He pops up now and then but I don't see him as my dad at all. I wouldn't tell him anyway, as he plays no role in my life. My mom... I think she might have a hunch, but I'm too scared to hurt her so I keep it all to myself. My siblings are more open minded and probably would support me, but I'm too big of a chicken to tell them

 It's hard for me to go out and do stuff, I always feel so confused and uncomfortable in most social scenes. I can't open up to anyone, because I've seen the awful things people do when they hear rumours or find out that you're homosexual... I still have hope that I'll find my place and finally be able to be free, to feel like you can actually tell everything you want, do whatever you wish... I'm still in high school and this is my last year, so I truly hope I find some place I can go after I graduate.

I know it's weird to write so intimate stuff about yourself in YouTube comments section, but after watching this movie I had to put my emotions somewhere and the only way I could do it is by doing it anonymously (hopefully no one knows I have this account... but what's the possibility of anyone stumbling onto this and knowing who I am. Right?)

Title: Love, Simon | Official Trailer 2 [HD] | 20th Century FOX
Comment:
I was in love with this movie for the most part. It captured a lot of what I felt as a teen in high school, all the ups and downs and anxieties and sorrows etc. But what I disliked mainly comes down to firstly Martin, not simply because he's a big issue for the protagonist, but because he is that way primarily because he's so unrealistically delusional and oblivious, even for a teenager. I mean honestly, I feel like he was a cartoon character that materialized solely to make life harder for Simon. I would have preferred a more believable source of antagonism if I'm being honest.

Secondly, the publicity given to the union of the two love interests. I'd just like to say first that I called that reveal halfway through, and I was SOOOO here for it, cause he was cute AF and he was so heavily focused on. Jumped outta my seat in glee when he arrived. But anyway, the Ferris Wheel publicity; do not support that at all. Because essentially, Blue is given the ultimatum of outing himself to everyone if he even wants to speak with Simon that night. As much I wanted their meeting, I would not have blamed him if he didn't want the entire freaking school as an audience for his coming out, and just didn't show up. And the fact that their moment wasn't really even private? Free to be recorded and spread around yet again? Had Blue not arrived, Simon's rejection would have been a public sob story. I wouldn't even approve of this for a straight couple, let alone these guys. Moments like these can get pretty personal or sensitive. Audiences are for weddings. Simon's got balls, and a fair bit of strength all things considered, but he could use a bit more tact.

But beyond that, I loved the movie. Really nice to see some positive outcomes.

Title: Love, Simon | Official Trailer 2 [HD] | 20th Century FOX
Comment: REALLY...."Best movie ever"!!! Either you have never seen any other quality movies (The Godfather, The Shawshank Redemption ,  Schindler's List, Casablanca, Citizen Kane, Gone with the Wind, One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest,  Lawrence of Arabia, The Sound of Music, West Side Story, Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope, 2001: A Space Odyssey, E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial, Singin' in the Rain, It's a Wonderful Life, Some Like It Hot, Ben-Hur, The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King, Gladiator, Titanic, Saving Private Ryan, Raiders of the Lost Ark, Rocky, To Kill a Mockingbird, A Clockwork Orange, Doctor Zhivago, Jaws,  Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, Platoon, Braveheart, Dances with Wolves, Jurassic Park, Goodfellas, The French Connection, City Lights, It Happened One Night, Rain Man,  The Grapes of Wrath, The Green Mile, American Graffiti, Pulp Fiction,  Good Will Hunting, and the list from the book of all great films goes on and on SO CHECK YOUR FACTS before making a wild claim like "best movie ever" AS THAT SOUNDS EXACTLY LIKE SOMEONE FROM A FILM STUDIO OR MARKETING AGENCY who's interpretation of "ever" is the last five minutes, SO you either work for the studio/marketing company that produced this film. I checked several other books, reference, IMDB and i would find it hard pressed to state that this is the best film this week, as there were much bigger and more meaningful films that came out that very same week, month and this year. Thus if you want to CONTINUE TO MISLEAD PEOPLE then carry on, but if you want PEOPLE TO TAKE YOU SERIOUSLY, THEN AT LEAST DO 10-15 MINUTES OF BASIC RESEARCH, OR STATE THAT "IN YOUR OPINION, THIS IS THE BEST FILM EVER"!!! As for groundbreaking films of the late 20th and early 21st century you have films like "Swordfish" and "The Matrix" both of which revolutionized the way scenes are filmed with "full 360 view" and "Bullet-Time", then you have films like Titanic, Avatar, and others that not only learned from these films but added story, visual, audio and other value to the viewer, this film.....not even in the ballpark, heck its not even a person sitting in their car in the parking lot of the ballpark, its just a teenage, "movie-of-the-moment" with a dash of liberal propaganda. Take a film appreciation class, read some books, or watch some actual "best movie's ever" (you'll find many listed above) and then you will have a much better understanding of what it means to say what you said.

Who else feels identified with this story, the book or the movie? well, I do, and I agree with Simon on something, it is easier to talk in the anonimatum than in person. 

I am really insecure, I really are the type of person that preffers to listen, but I´m getting tired of not being heared. This is not spam or something, I don´t have that intention, it is just that this story has teached me that there are people out there that have something to say and they can´t say it outloud, I´m one of those people, so this message is for someone who is interested to share secrets with me, or just stuff that you want to say to someone but you can´t. I want to be listened just for once in my life, you know? I don´t care gender, religion, etc, I´m not interested on making friends, I will like to chat with someone about stuff. If you want too, send me an email, I´ll be active these days to see how many people have the necessity of talk, who knows maybe we end up feeling we are Simon......... beyondsophie91@gmail.com

Title: Love, Simon | Official Trailer 2 [HD] | 20th Century FOX
Comment: Watched this last night. I thought it cute. A little frustrating at times as it was channeling Glee and HSM in terms of tone. The slapstick over the top 1 dimensional high school cliches didn’t really add to the impact of the subject matter. It would have been a better movie had the tone been more introspective like moonlight or BBM. The interactions between Simon and his bestie was potent enough, the film really didn’t need other characters that weren’t central to simons plight. While his story had a happy ending, it isn’t representative of many many a stories, and that’s the catch 22. You can be inspired by a movie or a movement to come out, but ultimately the rejection , those first words from your parents mouth, they will sting forever.

Title: Love, Simon | Official Trailer 2 [HD] | 20th Century FOX
Comment: This movie was beyond spectacular. I'm a 15-year-old closeted guy in the LGBTQ+ community and this film has changed my perspective in everything I do on a daily basis. I am forever grateful towards the cast and crew for helping me discover myself through a singular movie. The conflict Simon faces is so relatable, it's almost mesmerizing, and the acting is unparalleled. I would definitely recommend this movie to teenagers struggling with their identity in sexuality, because Love, Simon is undeniably the way to go. Get ready for a heart-warming, emotional journey filled with laughs and tears.

Title: Love, Simon | Official Trailer 2 [HD] | 20th Century FOX
Comment: When I first saw this trailer, I was a little in the middle because coming out shouldn't be a huge thing. But then I watched the movie and (SPOILERS)  I realized they addressed the character "Ethan," who came out and nobody cared because he just straight up admitted it and was open about it. Simon on the other hand, was thought to be straight for a while and people expected him to be, and he didn't even come out on his own terms- he was exposed by screenshots of his emails with Blue, his lover. So yes, the movie is self aware that coming out is a situation where nobody cares most of the time, but for Simon he had close friends and family that already made up their minds about his sexuality. He had a different situation where he didn't even get to come out on his own terms- thus leading him to do desperate things to hide his secret and hurts his friends along the way. By the end, Simon admits: why should my coming out be a huge thing? "Everyone deserves a great love story," is his conclusion.

Comment: I like the realism featured in it, so far. It reminds me a bit of Edge of 17. I've never cared much for coming of age based movies, until Edge of 17. This looks like it might be as good. (In my opinion, it was a good movie) Light humor and specifics on the emotions of the characters and those around them. Seems cool to me. I hope those who go to see it, can enjoy it! Those who don't care to, that's cool too. Everyone has their own prefrances. Naturally and chosen. In everything. So, let everyone have and keep their own. Just stay seperated and do your own things. Our lives aren't chained to oneanother for a reason. For many reasons. Take advantage of yours and let others do the same with theirs. As far as we know, the ones we live, are the only ones we've got. All that's relevant, right now. So, focus on living it how you choose and PERFER. That's the point of being born with free will, reguardless of what others try to convence you of doing with your life. The only one whose REALLY in control, is you. So keep that control and remain beautifully human. That's all I've got to say here. Have a great one, reader.

Comment: Prior before: Call me by your name and Love Simon. There were other great coming out movies being made outside the US, but never been seen by Americans in theaters. In the Grayscale, Esteros, and Cuatro Lunas, written in Spanish, great story lines, film and acting are exceptionally of good qualities,' if not better or equally to what we are seeing now. The way he Looks, is another coming out movie made in Brazil. The only differences about these movies are their budgets, most of them can't afford to compose their own songs, like Call me by your name, the song, Mystery of love, beautifully composes, despite being a low budget movie was a hit and help carry the movie into being nominated. Also most of them don't  have that Hollywood connections or distribution to reach American audience. Anyway its about time the LGBT is well representative, especially now with the political atmosphere that is happening in America.

Title: Love, Simon | Official Trailer 2 [HD] | 20th Century FOX
Comment:
I came out to my mom as bi and it’s as if she wasn’t listening. Like, she told me that she thought the Internet had a “negative influence” on me and made me bi. She also said it’s a hard life to CHOOSE, and when I pointed it out and said that it’s not a choice, she told me that she disagrees. 

She came into my room and this is what she said: 

Mom: “I think the internet is having a negative effect on you.”

Me: “What do you mean?”

Mom: “Well, you came out to me as a _lesbian_ on Valentine’s day...”

SHE SAID-
SHE SAID I CAME OUT TO HER AS A LESBIAN! LIKE, WAS SHE LISTENING AT ALL?? IM BI! IT TOOK SO MUCH COURAGE FOR ME TO TELL HER SO I WISH SHE WOULD LISTEN.....

*sigh* And I doubt I’d be allowed to see this movie because I’m sure that THATD be a bad influence, too. 

Great.

I give 20th Century Fox a big round of applause for making, producing and releasing a movie with such a realistic plot with the LGBTQ+ community. I will most definitely watch this with my family and when I get married to my man or woman and have our beautiful child, I will teach my child throughout her/his/their entire life that love is love no matter what and when my child wants to see what true love is, I will give my child this movie. A big thank you to Fox, the actors, the producers, the directors, and the entire crew for making this masterpiece!
